remediation.description: Text and images of text must have a contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1 (3:1 for large text).
remediation.technicalGuidance: Use tools like WebAIM Contrast Checker to verify contrast. Adjust color choices or add background opacity to achieve correct contrast.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: One of the most common reasons for fines from regulators. Especially important for public sector monitoring.
commonMistakes: Gray text on white background (#777 on #FFF)
Placeholder text with too low contrast
holmdigitalInsight.diggPrecedent: Regulators often cite poor contrast in primary navigation elements.
holmdigitalInsight.priorityRationale: Critical for users with low vision. Affects readability for all users in varying lighting conditions.

remediation.description: All functionality must be accessible via keyboard.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Use semantic HTML elements (button, a, input) instead of div/span with click handlers. Ensure tabindex is used correctly.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Keyboard access is fundamental and non-negotiable. Top priority in compliance audits.
commonMistakes: Custom dropdown menus without keyboard support
Modal dialogs that trap focus incorrectly
holmdigitalInsight.diggPrecedent: Auditors have issued fines for sites where core functions (e.g. forms, navigation) are not keyboard accessible.
holmdigitalInsight.priorityRationale: Critical for users with motor disabilities and screen reader users.

remediation.description: All images must have descriptive alternative text.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Add alt attributes to all img elements. For decorative images, use alt="". For informative images, concisely describe the content.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Especially important for logos and informational graphics. Frequently checked in audits.
commonMistakes: Alt text that just says 'image' or 'icon'
holmdigitalInsight.diggPrecedent: Audits frequently cite missing alt text, especially for vital infographics.
holmdigitalInsight.priorityRationale: Critical for screen reader users to access visual information.

remediation.description: Form fields must have clear labels or instructions.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Use label elements linked to input via for/id. For complex forms, use fieldset and legend. Use aria-describedby for extra instructions.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Forms are critical for e-services. Compliance is strictly enforced in public sector apps.
commonMistakes: Label and input not linked via for/id
holmdigitalInsight.diggPrecedent: Audit decisions often criticize poor form accessibility, especially for application and contact forms.
holmdigitalInsight.priorityRationale: Critical for users to successfully use e-services and submit information.

remediation.description: Each web page must have a descriptive title.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Use the title element in head. The title should be unique for each page and describe its purpose. Format: 'Page Name - Site Name'.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Important for navigation, especially in SPAs where the title must update dynamically.
commonMistakes: Too long or too short title
holmdigitalInsight.diggPrecedent: Audits have noted missing page titles, especially in Single Page Applications.
holmdigitalInsight.priorityRationale: Important for screen reader navigation and SEO.

remediation.description: Information, structure, and relationships conveyed through presentation can be programmatically determined or are available in text.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Use semantic HTML: <header>, <nav>, <main>, <footer>, <h1>-<h6>, <ul>/ <ol>, <table>. Do not use visual styles to create 'fake' headings or lists.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Semantic structure is crucial for screen readers to navigate effectively. Auditors often cite 'div-soup' that looks like structure but lacks semantics.
holmdigitalInsight.priorityRationale: Fundamental for all assistive technology navigation.

remediation.description: Color is not used as the only visual means of conveying information, indicating an action, prompting a response, or distinguishing a visual element.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Complement color with text, icons, or underlining. E.g. links must have underlines or another visual marker besides color. Error messages need text/icon, not just a red border.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Common problem in graphs and maps where only color coding is used.
commonMistakes: Links that only differ by color from body text
Error messages only marked with red color
Graphs where only color distinguishes data points

remediation.description: Content must be presentable without requiring scrolling in two dimensions down to 320px width.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Use responsive design (CSS Media Queries, Flexbox, Grid). Avoid fixed widths in pixels. Ensure tables and images scale correctly.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: A modern requirement (WCAG 2.1) critical for mobile use and magnified text. DIGG has zero tolerance for horizontal scroll on vertical sites.
holmdigitalInsight.priorityRationale: Critical for low vision users who zoom in heavily.

remediation.description: The visual presentation of user interface components and graphical objects must have a contrast ratio of at least 3:1 against adjacent colors.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Applies to buttons, input borders, icons, and focus indicators. Ensure all interactive elements are clearly visible against the background.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Often missed requirement regarding focus rings and inactive (but visible) components. Important for understanding the interface.
commonMistakes: Grayed out buttons with too low contrast

remediation.description: Content or functionality must not be lost when the user changes text spacing (line height, paragraph spacing, etc.).
remediation.technicalGuidance: Avoid fixed heights on text containers. Let containers grow with content. Test with text spacing bookmarklet.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Important for dyslexia adaptations.
commonMistakes: Text container that does not grow

remediation.description: Content shown on hover/focus (e.g. tooltips) must be Dismissable, Hoverable, and Persistent.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Ensure tooltips do not disappear when moving mouse from trigger to the tooltip itself. Allow ESC to dismiss.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Common problem with custom tooltips and mega-menus.
commonMistakes: Tooltips that cannot be reached with mouse
Content that cannot be dismissed without moving focus
holmdigitalInsight.priorityRationale: Important for users with magnification and motor difficulties.

remediation.description: Captions must be provided for all prerecorded audio content in synchronized media.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Use the <track> element with WebVTT files for HTML5 video. For social media embeds, ensure captions are enabled.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: One of the most common deficiencies in the public sector. The legal requirement is strict: video with audio MUST have captions.
commonMistakes: Auto-generated captions that satisfy no one
Captions burned into video (not accessible for search/translation)
holmdigitalInsight.priorityRationale: Critical for deaf and hard of hearing users.

remediation.description: Audio description must be provided for all prerecorded video content.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Either as a separate audio track, an alternative version of the video, or (if 'talking heads') ensuring all info is conveyed by audio.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Can often be solved by 'integrated description' (talking about what is seen), which is more cost-effective.
commonMistakes: Information shown only visually (graphics, text signs) without being mentioned in audio

remediation.description: Content must not restrict its view and operation to a single display orientation, unless a specific orientation is essential.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Do not lock screen to portrait or landscape via CSS or JS manifest. Use CSS media queries to handle layout changes.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Important for tablets and users who have the device mounted (e.g., wheelchair).
commonMistakes: Apps/sites that rotate interface 90 degrees against user will
holmdigitalInsight.priorityRationale: Important for users who cannot rotate their device.

remediation.description: The purpose of each input field collecting information about the user can be programmatically determined.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Use the 'autocomplete' attribute on input fields for personal data (name, email, tel, address etc.).

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Makes it much easier to fill confusing forms (autofill).
holmdigitalInsight.priorityRationale: Reduces cognitive load and motor requirements.

remediation.description: If focus can be moved to a component of the page using a keyboard interface, then focus can be moved away from that component using only a keyboard interface.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Be careful with JS widgets that trap focus (e.g. modal windows). Ensure there is always a way out (e.g. ESC or shift+tab).

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: A keyboard trap is a 'blocker' that makes the website unusable. Serious error.
commonMistakes: Custom widgets that loop focus infinitely
Embedded third-party components (maps, chats) without exit
holmdigitalInsight.priorityRationale: Critical: The user gets stuck and must restart the browser.

remediation.description: If a keyboard shortcut consists of only one character (letter, number, symbol), there must be a way to turn it off or remap it, or it must only be active on focus.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Avoid single-key shortcuts if possible. If needed, ensure they do not conflict with voice control or accidental typing.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Important for voice control users (Dragon etc.) where single words can trigger commands accidentally.
commonMistakes: Gmail-like shortcuts that are on by default without option to disable

remediation.description: If a time limit (session, reading time) is set, the user must be able to turn off, adjust, or extend it.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Provide a warning before the session expires with an 'Extend session' button. The time limit must be at least 20 seconds.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Critical for e-services/banking. Users who read slowly or use assistive technology need more time.
commonMistakes: Time limits that cannot be extended
holmdigitalInsight.priorityRationale: Critical to avoid losing entered data.

remediation.description: For moving, blinking, or scrolling content that starts automatically and lasts more than 5 seconds, there must be a way to pause, stop, or hide it.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Applies to carousels (sliders), auto-updating news feeds, animated backgrounds. Add a clear pause button.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Important for users with concentration difficulties (ADHD/Autism) who are distracted by movement.
commonMistakes: Animated backgrounds that cannot be turned off

remediation.description: Content must not flash more than three times per second (can cause seizures).
remediation.technicalGuidance: Avoid rapid flashing in video and animations. Use tools to measure flash frequency (PEAT).

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Health risk. Zero tolerance.

remediation.description: There must be a way to skip blocks of content that are repeated on multiple pages (e.g. navigation).
remediation.technicalGuidance: Implement a 'Skip to Main Content' link at the top of the page that becomes visible on focus. Use semantic landmarks (<main>, <nav>).

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Standard on all public sector sites. Enormously helpful for keyboard users.
commonMistakes: Skip-link broken (does not move focus correctly)

remediation.description: Focus order must be logical and follow meaning/structure.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Match DOM order with visual order. Avoid tabindex greater than 0. Manage focus manually in modals and menus.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Critical for complex layouts (Grid/Flexbox) where visual order may differ from DOM order.
commonMistakes: Modal closes and focus returns to top of page
holmdigitalInsight.priorityRationale: Critical for keyboard navigation and understanding.

remediation.description: The purpose of each link can be understood from the link text alone or from the link text together with its context.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Avoid 'Read more' or 'Click here'. Write descriptive link texts. Use aria-label if visual space is limited but more info is needed.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Important for users navigating via link lists (screen readers).
commonMistakes: Links that don't say where they lead

remediation.description: There must be more than one way to find a web page within a set of web pages.
remediation.technicalGuidance: At least two of: Menu, Search, Sitemap, Links in content.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Often fulfilled by menu + search. Sitemap is best practice.
commonMistakes: Missing search on sites with many pages

remediation.description: Headings and labels must describe topic or purpose.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Write clear, descriptive headings that give meaning to the content below them. Form labels must be understandable.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: About editorial quality and comprehensibility.
commonMistakes: Labels that don't match what needs to be filled in

remediation.description: Any user interface operable by keyboard must have a visible focus indicator.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Never remove outline with CSS (outline: none) without replacing it with a clear visual indicator. Ensure contrast of focus ring is sufficient (see 1.4.11).

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: One of the most common errors. Often because designers dislike the 'blue ring'.
holmdigitalInsight.priorityRationale: Critical: Without visible focus, the keyboard user doesn't know where they are.

remediation.description: The default human language of each web page must be programmatically determinable.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Set the 'lang' attribute on the <html> element. E.g., <html lang='en'> for English.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Fundamental for screen reading. Without this, the screen reader guesses the language, often leading to wrong pronunciation.
commonMistakes: Wrong language code (e.g. 'en' on a Swedish page)

remediation.description: The human language of each passage or phrase in the content must be programmatically determinable.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Use the lang attribute on elements that differ from the page's main language. E.g. Bonjour.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Rarely a critical error unless it significantly hinders understanding.
commonMistakes: Foreign quotes in text without markup

remediation.description: When a component receives focus, it must not initiate a change of context.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Do not open new windows, submit forms, or move focus automatically just because user tabs to a field.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Very confusing for users. Creates a feeling of lack of control.
commonMistakes: Dropdowns that navigate immediately upon selection (without 'Go' button)
Forms that auto-submit on last field focus

remediation.description: Changing the setting of any component does not automatically cause a change of context unless the user has been advised of the behavior before using the component.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Inform the user that selection in a list reloads the page. Preferably, add a button to confirm the choice.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Common in filtering functions.

remediation.description: Navigational mechanisms that are repeated on multiple Web pages occur in the same relative order each time they are repeated.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Main menu should look the same and be in the same place on all pages. Search function as well.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Predictability is key to cognitive accessibility.
commonMistakes: Menus that change place or order on different pages

remediation.description: Components that have the same functionality within a set of Web pages are identified consistently.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Don't call search 'Search' on one page and 'Find' on another. Use the same icon for the same function.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Important for usability.

remediation.description: If an input error is automatically detected, the item that is in error is identified and the error is described to the user in text.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Show error message close to the field. Link with aria-describedby or include in label. Do not just color the field red.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Critical for completing tasks. Generic error messages ('Something went wrong') are not accepted if the error is specific.
commonMistakes: Error message not visible to screen readers

remediation.description: If an input error is automatically detected and suggestions for correction are known, then the suggestions are provided to the user.
remediation.technicalGuidance: If date format is wrong, show required format (YYYY-MM-DD). Offer spelling suggestions for search ('Did you mean...?').

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: About being helpful. Reduces support cases.
commonMistakes: Only saying 'Error' without saying how to fix it

remediation.description: For Web pages that cause legal commitments or financial transactions, users must be able to: Reverse, Check, or Confirm.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Offer a summary page before final submission with ability to edit.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Absolute requirement for e-commerce and legal decisions.
commonMistakes: Submission of binding contracts without review
holmdigitalInsight.priorityRationale: Critical to avoid serious consequences of mistakes.

remediation.description: Update: From WCAG 2.2 this criterion is removed/obsolete, but in WCAG 2.1/EN 301 549 it applies: IDs must be unique, elements correctly nested.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Validate HTML. Ensure id attributes are unique on the page. Close all tags correctly.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Less prioritized now as modern browsers handle errors well, but duplicate IDs can still break ARIA.

remediation.description: For all components, name and role can be programmatically determined. Values can be set programmatically.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Use native HTML elements when possible. If custom components are used, ARIA (role, aria-label, aria-valuenow) must be used correctly.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: This is the foundation for how screen readers work with modern web apps. Without this, the app is 'invisible' to assistive technology.

remediation.description: Statusmeddelanden ska kunna presenteras fr anvndaren utan att motta fokus (via skrmlsare).
remediation.technicalGuidance: Anvnd aria-live regioner (polite/assertive) eller role='status'/'alert' fr meddelanden som dyker upp dynamiskt (t.ex. 'Sparat', 'Skning klar').

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Important in SPAs where page load does not happen. The user must know something happened.
holmdigitalInsight.priorityRationale: Provides feedback to users without sight.

remediation.description: The page must have exactly one 'main' landmark.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Use the <main> element once per page to identify the main content. Avoid having multiple <main> without unique labels, or missing it entirely.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Screen reader users rely on landmarks to navigate quickly to the content. Missing <main> makes it difficult to skip navigation.

remediation.description: The page must have a level 1 heading (<h1>).
remediation.technicalGuidance: Ensure there is exactly one <h1> describing the page's unique content.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: A clear <h1> is critical for users to understand where they have landed. It is often the first thing a screen reader user looks for.
commonMistakes: Using logo as the only <h1> without text

remediation.description: Headings must follow a logical order (h1 -> h2 -> h3).
remediation.technicalGuidance: Do not skip heading levels (e.g. directly from h1 to h3).

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Incorrect heading structure makes it difficult for screen readers to navigate. Never skip levels.
commonMistakes: Using h3 for styling instead of structure

remediation.description: The banner (<header>) must be at the top level.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Do not place <header> inside another landmark if it is the page's main banner.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: The page's main menu/banner must be located correctly in the structure to be found quickly.

remediation.description: The page must have only one 'banner' landmark (usually <header>).
remediation.technicalGuidance: Ensure you only have one <header> at the top level.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Multiple banners confuse navigation. There should be only one top header.
commonMistakes: Having header both at top and bottom

remediation.description: Landmarks must have unique roles or labels.
remediation.technicalGuidance: If you have multiple <nav> elements, give them unique 'aria-label' (e.g., 'Main Menu', 'Footer Menu').

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: The user must be able to distinguish between different menus/regions. Give them names.

remediation.description: All content on the page must be contained within landmarks (regions).
remediation.technicalGuidance: Ensure all content is inside <main>, <header>, <nav>, <footer>, or <aside>.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: For screen reader users to navigate effectively, the page must be divided into logical regions.

remediation.description: Prerecorded video content must have audio description if visual information is critical.
remediation.technicalGuidance: Provide an alternative audio track or version describing what happens visually.

holmdigitalInsight.swedishInterpretation: Video conveying information visually must be described for those who cannot see the screen.
commonMistakes: Video missing audio description despite important visual info
